content:
From: Christian Sternagel <christian.sternagel@uibk.ac.at>
Hi there,

am I correct that isabelle-process (which we use to generate unfinished
heap files) does always work on just 1 core (at least on PCs)?

I came to this conclusion since:
1) on none of my machines, isabelle-process ever used more than one core
(yes they have at least one more :)).
2) there is no possibility to tell isabelle-process, how many cores it
should use (in contrast to isabelle usedir's -M).

However, on a colleague's machine (a Mac), isabelle-process seems to use
all cores (and thus starts to swap rather soon).

best regards

chris
